programme.title: Strangest Things
programme.sub-title: The Jericho Head, The Cloudbuster and the Map
programme.desc: Perplexing historical objects include the Jericho Head, a 9,000-year-old clay-covered artifact. Plus, a 1950s machine built to control the weather and a map that could be the oldest ever found

programme.title: Strangest Things
programme.sub-title: The Lost Standard, the Steam Gun and the Sacrificial Throne
programme.desc: This latest collection of objects comprises an intriguing 35,000-year-old box, a steam-powered gun and a monument that may have been an Aztec throne

programme.title: WWIIs Most Daring Raids
programme.desc: Recounting how on the outskirts of Bouerat Harbor in Libya, a small group of British special forces made plans to destroy a crucial German fuel depot, regarded as a lifeline for Nazi forces

programme.title: WWII Battles in Colour
programme.desc: The events of June 1941, when cameras rolled as Nazi Germany launched an all-out assault on the Soviet Union

programme.title: WWII Lost Films
programme.desc: Documentary highlighting life during the Second World War, recounting how rookie platoon leader Charles Scheffel suffered his first losses as he battled Rommels Afrika Korps in Tunisia

programme.title: Secrets Declassified with David Duchovny
programme.desc: Through use of recently declassified CIA documents, the X-Files actor uncovers some of the most closely guarded government secrets from post-war history. These are mysteries and conspiracies some have long suspected, but are yet to hear answers to

programme.title: Bradley Walsh: Egypts Cosmic Code
programme.desc: The presenter and one-time Rolls Royce engineer fulfils a lifetimes ambition to visit the monuments of Ancient Egypt in a bid to understand how it could have been possible to produce such wonders of the ancient world 4,500 years ago. An expert guide is on hand to lay out the mainstream thinking and act as the perfect foil for Bradley and his theories

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: The possible truth behind a pattern of UFO sightings near volcanos. Plus, the origin of the strange stone spheres of Costa Rica and the secret of an unidentified man living alone in the jungle

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.sub-title: UFO Window Seat and Lost Underwater City
programme.desc: An examination of several seemingly impossible things. This episode features the sighting of a UFO from the window seat of a passenger jet, a strange underwater discovery said to be a lost Japanese city and an odd series of tunnels in Brazil

programme.desc: Key events of the Second World War, beginning with Germany invading Poland, and touching on Japans expansion in Asia. Plus, how Africas colonies became key battlegrounds for power and resources

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on an expedition along Dorsets Jurassic coast to explore the countys hidden Second World War story. Starting beside the defences on Chesil Beach, he heads east to finish in Swanage and Studland Bay. On his five-day walk he encounters stunning scenery and uncovers wartime acts of ingenuity and bravery. He also discovers the crucial part a swannery played in developing a secret weapon and reveals the role of Dorset in protecting Britain from invasion during the conflict

programme.title: Gangland Chronicles

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars check out a pair of vintage rock t-shirts, Gumby and Pokey toys, a poster by Israeli artist Gad Ullman and unopened Atari games

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller shoots for the moon, when he comes in with some Apollo 11 documents. Then, a Harley Davidson 1962 Topper scoots into the shop. Next, Rick checks out a Renoir etching

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: The remaining participants face significant struggles, including one survivalist dealing with a ruined shelter and another struggling with hunger after losing their strength

programme.title: Kevin Costners The West
programme.desc: The lives of Protestant missionaries Marcus and Narcissa Whitman, who sought to spread their Christian faith and bring their way of life to the Cayuse people. They helped facilitate the colonisation of the Oregon Country via the Oregon Trail before ultimately being killed during an attack on the mission site in 1847

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts explores the medieval history of Lincoln, visiting the cathedral that was once the tallest building in the world and re-living the battle at Lincoln Castle. She discovers how moving up the social ladder in medieval times required a whole new wardrobe of clothing and accessories and gets top grips with a historically accurate crossbow. Aerial archaeologist Ben Robinson uses the latest drone technology to look at the geographical features that shaped the citys development

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores Londons Restoration history, including the founding of the Royal Society and the violent dark side behind Charles IIs carefully crafted public image. She visits St Pauls Cathedral, reveals how women performed on stage for the first time during this period, and uncovers shocking details of the slave trade at the National Maritime Museum. Plus, a look at parallels between the plague that struck London during the 1660s and the Covid-19 pandemic

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts visits Portsmouth to investigate the history of the Royal Navy, uncovering some uncomfortable truths behind the myth surrounding Lord Horatio Nelson and getting first-hand experience of what life would have been like in the heat of battle at Trafalgar. She also visits an archaeological dig on Burrow Island and a lantern show at the New Theatre Royal, and discovers the brutal punishments doled out for even minor offences by the Victorian penal system

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.sub-title: East: Stone Age Engineering and Battle of Bullecourt
programme.desc: Alice Roberts investigates the best archaeological discoveries of 2018 from the East of the UK, including an ancient lost monument as old as Stonehenge uncovered in Suffolk, a dig at the site of Britains first tank battle, and a coin hoard that offers an insight into the effect the English civil war had on the lives of ordinary people

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts joins archaeologists in the North as they uncover writing tablets, swords and domestic items left by Romans at Vindolanda during a time of British rebellion, before finding traces of a long lost monastery and pilgrimage site on the Scottish island of Iona. Meanwhile in the east of Scotland, a weapons hoard belonging to a wealthy Bronze Age warrior is unearthed

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts follows archaeologists as they unearth Britains most spectacular iron-age grave, a chariot burial in East Yorkshire. The programme also follows two other archaeological digs, an Iron-Age hill fort found in North Wales, and the remains of six roundhouses on the bed of Loch Tay in Perthshire, Scotland

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.sub-title: West: Roman Bathhouse and Hessian Camp
programme.desc: Alice Roberts investigates the best archaeological discoveries of 2018 from the West of the UK, including the biggest maritime excavation since the Mary Rose which revealed the extraordinary story of the HMS Invincible, a buried German military camp in Hampshire, and a monumental Roman Bathhouse in Silchester

programme.title: The Abyss: Rise and Fall of the Nazis
programme.desc: A fresh look at the Third Reich from a global and current perspective, telling how the Nazis conquered Germany and then half of Europe within a few years of losing the First World War. This first episode recounts how the clash of right-wing and left-wing political convictions turned the Weimar Republic into a powder keg. The fascist movement then seized power in Italy in 1922

programme.title: The Abyss: Rise and Fall of the Nazis
programme.desc: How the failed coup on November 9, 1923 eliminated Hitler and then movement of some 55,000 members. The Fuhrer and his National Socialist German Workers Party achieved a miserable result in the 1928 Reichstag elections

programme.desc: The work of law enforcement and customs officers at busy US airports. programme.desc: An analysis of the life of German officer and physician Josef Mengele, exploring his youth and studies, his adherence to Nazism, the inhumane experiments conducted at Auschwitz and the connection between Nazism and the German academic system

programme.title: Mengele Unveiled
programme.sub-title: Auschwitz - Unveiling the Angel of Death
programme.desc: An analysis of the life of German officer and physician Josef Mengele, exploring his youth and studies, his adherence to Nazism, the inhumane experiments conducted at Auschwitz and the connection between Nazism and the German academic system

programme.title: Mengele Unveiled
programme.desc: An analysis of the life of German officer and physician Josef Mengele, exploring his youth and studies, his adherence to Nazism, the inhumane experiments conducted at Auschwitz and the connection between Nazism and the German academic system. The series recounts his long fugitive life, also filled with legends to debunk, and delves into the le circumstances that allowed the most wanted Nazi criminal in the world to die a free man on the beach of Bertioga in Brazil

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David Attenborough employs the latest technologies to explore the violence, rivalries and deadly weaponry existing within the world of bugs. This first episode examines the survival tactics of its terrifying residents including killer ants, trap-setting spiders and beetles with the ability to shoot boiling chemicals at their enemies

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The broadcaster continues his bug-eyed view of the world of creepy-crawlies, revealing how predators defuse the defences of their prey. Highlights include the cockroach wasp, busy preparing a tasty - and very live - treat for its young, the whirligig beetle, which employs a water-based radar system, and the jumping portia spider, which feeds on other arachnids

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A further selection of creepy-crawly close-ups, focusing on courtship in the bug world. Highlights include scorpions shaking their booty, the perfume-wearing nasonia wasp and the tropical cricket, for whom romance goes out of the window as it uses bribery to seal the deal with would-be partners. One potential partner to steer well clear of, however, is the praying mantis, the female of which is notorious for eating the male just after - or even during - mating. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A close-up view of sex, bug-style, as David Attenborough talks viewers through the different ways in which creepy-crawlies reproduce. Size matters for the minuscule male orb spider, creepily sneaking up on its intended and trying to mate without her noticing, while theres no rest for the lothario-like butterfly, which has plenty of notches on its proverbial bedpost. However, the harvestman spider has no use for sex at all, and reproduces by cloning itself

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David Attenborough shifts the focus to bugs that prefer co-operation rather than conflict. They include burrowing cockroaches, the suitably named social spiders - which share a 30-metre web - the queen bee and her happy hive of workers and green ants pulling together to build a nest

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The broadcaster concludes his close-up examination of the creepy-crawly world, shifting focus to the bugs ultimate invention - the colony. Key residents of these minuscule mega-cities include honey bees, termites, leafcutter ants - who have a knack for farming - and their Argentine cousins, members of a community so vast it spans an entire continent

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A further selection of creepy-crawly close-ups, focusing on courtship in the bug world. Highlights include scorpions shaking their booty, the perfume-wearing nasonia wasp and the tropical cricket, for whom romance goes out of the window as it uses bribery to seal the deal with would-be partners. One potential partner to steer well clear of, however, is the praying mantis, the female of which is notorious for eating the male just after - or even during - mating. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A close-up view of sex, bug-style, as David Attenborough talks viewers through the different ways in which creepy-crawlies reproduce. Size matters for the minuscule male orb spider, creepily sneaking up on its intended and trying to mate without her noticing, while theres no rest for the lothario-like butterfly, which has plenty of notches on its proverbial bedpost. However, the harvestman spider has no use for sex at all, and reproduces by cloning itself

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David Attenborough shifts the focus to bugs that prefer co-operation rather than conflict. They include burrowing cockroaches, the suitably named social spiders - which share a 30-metre web - the queen bee and her happy hive of workers and green ants pulling together to build a nest

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The broadcaster concludes his close-up examination of the creepy-crawly world, shifting focus to the bugs ultimate invention - the colony. Key residents of these minuscule mega-cities include honey bees, termites, leafcutter ants - who have a knack for farming - and their Argentine cousins, members of a community so vast it spans an entire continent

She meets Padraig McGovern, Sabina McCague, and Bacaigh Iarthar an Chláir among others, uncovering the music and rituals that celebrate love in Ireland. With dancers, storytellers and musicians like Jojo Marrinan, Grainne Fennell, Mairead Uí Lionáird, and Tom and Sham Hyland, this concluding chapter is a moving celebration of the power of traditional music that brings people together

Through intimate, irreverent and entertaining interviews and a rich cache of archival footage, it traces the rise, challenges and impact of communism on Irish politics, society and culture. The film climaxes with the Soviet Unions collapse and reflects on communisms legacy in Ireland

programme.title: Speed with Guy Martin
programme.sub-title: Speed with Guy Martin: F1 Special
programme.desc: Ahead of the new Formula 1 season on Channel 4 this weekend, Guy Martin goes head to head with racing legend David Coulthard in the ultimate test of bike against car. With David in a Red Bull RB8 Formula 1 car and Guy on his Tyco BMW Superbike, the pair race in a series of challenges including a drag race, a brake test, slalom and a full-on circuit race. Theres also entertainment in the pit as they compete in physical and mental challenges, testing their fitness and reaction times and exploring the science behind their chosen racing machines

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May immerse themselves in nostalgia and try to prove that hot hatches from their younger days are better than their modern equivalents. Jeremy grabs the keys to a Volkswagen Golf GTI, Richard takes the wheel of a Vauxhall Nova SRi and James May opts for the Ford Fiesta XR2i, and the trio set off on a road trip that includes a hill climb and a visit to a supermarket. However, their adventure concludes at an army training ground in Wales, where they and their steeds must face the heavily armed Top Gear Police Department. Downton Abbey star Hugh Bonneville blasts the Reasonably Priced Car around the test track

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the armys vehicle redeployment efforts, and actor Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees bidders in Lewes battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers look across the Channel to see how the French have influenced British food over the centuries. They prepare a roast chicken with 40 cloves of garlic, and a delicate mille feuille, and examine UK products in traditionally French areas of gastronomy, from award-winning English wines to Scottish garlic

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers examine the history behind some of the nations most famous dishes, beginning by exploring how the monarchy has influenced British cuisine. The duo also prepare a classic coronation chicken, and a beef dish named after Prince Albert, and food historian Ivan Day whips up a meal using a cookbook from the time of James II

programme.title: Speed with Guy Martin
programme.sub-title: Speed with Guy Martin: F1 Special
programme.desc: Ahead of the new Formula 1 season on Channel 4 this weekend, Guy Martin goes head to head with racing legend David Coulthard in the ultimate test of bike against car. With David in a Red Bull RB8 Formula 1 car and Guy on his Tyco BMW Superbike, the pair race in a series of challenges including a drag race, a brake test, slalom and a full-on circuit race. Theres also entertainment in the pit as they compete in physical and mental challenges, testing their fitness and reaction times and exploring the science behind their chosen racing machines

programme.title: Wilderness with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon travels through Patagonia at the foot of the South American continent, a beautiful and rugged land of mountains, ice and endless wild grasslands, His journey takes him up to the huge South Patagonian ice field, through the foothills of the Andes towards the great Grey Glacier of eastern Chile. In Taibo and Jauny, Simon encounters two gauchos, the cowboys of South America, who live isolated lives in the mountains, tending their livestock and braving the storms in a simple hut for months on end

programme.title: Special Ops: To Catch a Criminal
programme.desc: Manchester police take down a gang of teen car thieves, and the Serious Fraud Office unravels a 400-million-pound global fraud in the steel industry

programme.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: The friends head to the tidal outcrop of Burgh Island on the south coast of Devon to fish for wrasse, and Bob kickstarts their trip with a huge surprise for Paul. Keen to test the surrounding waters, Paul walks down to the beach, but is met with an unexpected but familiar face, while he also encounters a rather unconventional fishing approach. Will he be tempted to stray from his tried and tested methods?

programme.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Bob and Paul return to the Peak District, this time with Ted, where they filmed their first episode of Gone Fishing six years ago. They start by fishing in the Wye at Haddon Hall, which was built in the 11th century and has been visited by countless kings and queens, with Paul on a quest to catch a rainbow trout. They then head off to the Derwent, where they compare their and Teds health to that of the UKs rivers

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell is guest host of this extended episode, with comedian Ria Lina and Sunday Times journalist Tim Shipman joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers she finds most interesting. The show has now reached the letter R, and begins with a rather Rude episode. Joining Sandi are John Barrowman, Phill Jupitus, Aisling Bea and regular panellist Alan Davies

programme.desc: A marine machine boils over as Christopher bleeds out, Luke cuts loose as ten tonnes of trouble leaves the team high and dry, and Shaun and Sarah handle a red-hot recovery

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May ask whether the Eastern Bloc countries ever made a good car, and Richard Hammond assesses the performance of German sports model the Veritas. The Ford Fiesta is also put through its paces in a stringent road test, and Mayor of London Boris Johnson is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: James May visits California to learn about the hydrogen-fuelled Honda FCX Clarity, and Jeremy Clarkson assesses the performance of Teslas battery-powered supercar the Roadster. Richard Hammond looks back over 50 years of British touring car racing, and singer Tom Jones is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Rick Steins Secret France
programme.desc: Ricks journey takes him to the Spanish border and the Mediterranean coast. He discovers how Catalan and French influences have shaped the culinary legacy of Roussillon in the foothills of the Pyrenees, and samples some of the areas famous mountain cuisine, including grilled sausages, snails and fresh fish caught in a self-contained seawater lake - all with generous servings of the regions famous garlic mayonnaise. Back in his country kitchen, Rick prepares pork and beef meatballs in a tomato and piment sauce

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers demonstrate how to create gourmet lunches on a tight budget, receiving tips from one of Britains leading Indian chefs and getting insider advice on buying wine on a shoestring. Finally, they put everything they have learned to the test when they arrange a surprise meal for a dinner lady

Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on one another

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by radio presenter Sara Cox, comedian Jason Manford, journalist Nick Robinson and actor Harry Shearer, who aim to help the team captains deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Guest panellists Jack Dee, Romesh Ranganathan, Gaby Roslin and Tinchy Stryder join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy show in which participants attempt to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: The game show where treachery lurks around every corner! Tempers rise between the members of the original Laumei tribe, and Dante saves his strength for the immunity challenge.

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: Who needs friends with enemies like the ones on this show? Doubts about trust within the spit-shake alliance leaves a few members feeling particularly vulnerable this time around.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: Paul Danan finally gets his day in court with Shaun Williamson after a pantomime-based fallout, while a husband is sick and tired of his miserly wife ruining Christmas

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part story, a body found in woodland is identified as that of an 11-year-old boy not reported missing until two days after his disappearance. His computer reveals that he was planning to run away from his dysfunctional family with a friend, but failed to turn up at the appointed time. Neil remains aloof from his team, only confiding in Banksy, as his son undergoes chemotherapy to combat leukaemia. Emily Joyce (My Hero) guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Concluding the two-part story. Max orders an observation of the dead boys stepfather at the funeral after discovering he has ties with known villains suspected of violent robberies. Neil, still trying to deal with the news that his son needs chemotherapy, is furious when he discovers what his team has been up to, and Maxs erratic behaviour becomes the talk of the station, even though his strong-arm tactics produce a lead on a lorry hijack planned for later that day

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Max is anxious to arrest a man known to be grooming teenage girls online, but Grace urges him to bug the suspects home and gather watertight evidence to ensure a conviction. Mickey and Terry realise Maxs erratic behaviour is a result of drug abuse, and as the case threatens to go awry, Terry gives his superior officer an ultimatum

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: When PCs Gayle and Roberts discover an abandoned car, their investigation soon takes on a new dimension. DI Manson tells team about his sons illness

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Following the discovery of the body of a Venezuelan woman on a rubbish dump, Kirsty and Leon are instrumental in tracing family members who lead them to the womans partner and son on the Larkmead Estate, where the PCs are faced with a harrowing scene. The traumatic day brings the pair together, and they go home together after an evenings drinking

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: The WI members of Great Paxford live under a shadow as the Battle of Britain looms on the horizon. Pat befriends a Czech soldier, but finds her newfound independence less enjoyable than expected. Laura faces the consequences of her affair, while Sarah receives some shocking news. Alison strikes a bargain with the police, and tragedy strikes for Frances

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: Laura is publicly disgraced when news of the Bowers divorce hits the papers, with grave consequences for the surgery and her friendship with Tom. Pat is tempted by her feelings for Marek while Bob is in hospital. Steph is delighted when Stan returns home on leave, but the reunion is overshadowed by his fears of invasion. Frances discovers a secret at the reading of the will

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: The Czech officers organise a dance to keep morale up as the Battle of Britain intensifies. Joyce has some advice for Sarah which is not well received, while Pat realises that somebody knows about her relationship with Marek. Allisons secret work for the police forces her to decide where her loyalties lie. Steph fears that Stan is becoming a bad influence on his son and Frances finds out that Peters affair was more complicated than she thought

programme.title: Catherine Cooksons Tilly Trotter
programme.desc: First in a two-part period drama about a 19-year-old woman who is making her home from an engagement party when she is attacked by Hal McGrath, who plans to get his hands on her familys money by forcing her into marriage. Her screams save her - but the incident prompts some villagers to brand her a witch. Carli Norris stars

programme.title: Catherine Cooksons Tilly Trotter
programme.desc: Part two of two. Homeless and out of work, Tilly moves in with Biddy Drew and her children. Unable to find other employment, she takes a job at the local mine along with Katie - and despite the hard work, she enjoys feeling part of the family. Drama, starring Carli Norris and Sarah Jane Foster

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: The part-time sleuth is surprised by a visit from her mother, who is worried about her husbands obsession with a belief that catastrophic events relating to the Cold War are being planned at the British open chess championships. Sister Boniface decides to brush up on her chess skills and enter the tournament. Lorna Watson stars

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Harry is disturbed to be called to a crime scene at the home of a family he knows, and finds the bodies of the mother and her teenage daughter, while her stepson lies in a coma - although her toddler has been left unharmed. The police suspect the womans husband to be the killer, but the pathologist is not so sure of his guilt

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The unsolved-crime squad reopens the case of an Asian woman who was attacked eight years ago, and has been in a coma ever since. After enlisting the aid of a community liaison officer, it becomes apparent there is conflict in the victims family, as well as a possible connection with the disappearance of a private detective. Nina Wadia, Keith Allen and Navin Chowdhry guest star

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: Excessive flushing sounds convince an elderly woman that her neighbour has killed his wife and is disposing of her body parts via the toilet. Naturally, Davies is sent to investigate, and it isnt long before the detective has gained a broken nose and an obsessive stalker. Meanwhile, Mod lands a job in the mobile catering industry. Anna Wing (once of EastEnders) guest stars in the detective drama, with Peter Davison and Sean Hughes

programme.title: 2point4 Children
programme.desc: Bills hopes for a stress-free day are cruelly dashed when Jenny receives unpleasant news and Rona stares disaster in the face

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Sister Boniface investigates when a killer scarecrow wreaks havoc at the annual Scarecrow Festival

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The regiments tour in Germany is cut short. Meanwhile, a prank in the Officers Mess causes trouble for Tucker. Starring Robson Green and Rob Spendlove

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: A man keeps his illness a secret as he is worried it might affect his sons future as a dancer, and a furious Greg loses his temper with Rico. Medical drama, starring Felix DAlviella and Ben Jones

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: An ex-Army bouncer finds the courage to ask the doctors for help, while Joe finally manages to get a laugh out of Julia

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Chrissies affair with Alistair becomes public knowledge, but she remains defiant, insisting she tried to put an end to it before anyone could get hurt. Meanwhile, Ric is forced to compromise his beliefs in order to raise cash for his student daughter, and Janices marital woes alter the way she deals with the mother of a patient who appears to be guilty of infidelity

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Ruth begins the morning in a good mood, but her confidence is knocked when Toby completes a medical procedure that eluded her, and she struggles to deal with her feelings. Curtis is troubled while tending to a boy he appears to know and later lays flowers on a grave. Ian Lavender guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Leon is still suffering flashbacks of the traumatic events of the previous day and agrees with Kirsty to regard their night together as a one-off. A pregnant woman is seriously injured in what appears to be a carjacking, and a suspect is traced, but later released for lack of evidence. Leon is sent home after losing his temper with the villain, only to defy orders and take matters into his own hands

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Janines game-playing gets her into trouble with Jack. Meanwhile, Patrick faces heartache, and Jays plan is foiled.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Janine gets her own back on Jack, leaving him chained to the club. Meanwhile, Bradleys not impressed with his dads idea of entertainment, and has Jay had enough of the Square?

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Transatlantic rivalry breaks out when the officers have to share a barracks with a platoon of American soldiers. Starring Jerome Flynn and Gary Love

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Hector is so incensed by the sudden arrival of his pregnant daughter Lizzie that he decides to disown her. Meanwhile, Archie races to reconcile his feuding family, and Katrina faces a difficult decision. Light-hearted Scottish drama, starring Richard Briers and Susan Hampshire

programme.title: Londons Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch are called to a hotel fire and discover blocked escape routes threaten the safety of guests. Elsewhere, Sicknote has finally had enough of politics

programme.title: Allo Allo!
programme.desc: Rene and the others make the final preparations for the parade, while the general, the colonel and Gruber play a round of golf, during which they discuss the plot to blow up Hitler

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Jane and Dianas strip-club hen night proves to be a real eye-opener, then a double booking with a funeral at the church throws the happy couples wedding plans into chaos. Comedy, starring Graham Crowden and Stephanie Cole

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: A Short Introduction to Coopers Rules
programme.desc: Local PCs Cooper and Walsh try to master a new crime-fighting technique. However, the duos carefully laid plans unravel when Barry decides to treat a retired vicar to a day trip. Long-running sitcom, starring Ken Kitson and Louis Emerick

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The women of the village are impressed by a series of fanciful tales told by a retired jewel thief about his larcenous exploits in the south of France. However, the scoundrels skills are put to the test when Marina and Miss Davenport seek his aid in helping Auntie Wainwright crack a keyless safe. John Challis guest stars

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detective struggles to cope following the death of his wife and suffers more grief when the body of his godson is discovered in a bricked-up drain 12 years after he went missing. Lynley himself becomes a suspect when the boys sister is found dead, forcing him to enlist the help of his lawyer and DS McCaffreys son to prove his innocence. Crime drama, starring Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Nicholas Farrell

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The unsolved-crime squad reopens the case of an Asian woman who was attacked eight years ago, and has been in a coma ever since. After enlisting the aid of a community liaison officer, it becomes apparent there is conflict in the victims family, as well as a possible connection with the disappearance of a private detective. Nina Wadia, Keith Allen and Navin Chowdhry guest star

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: Beth Bailey is thrown in at the deep end on her first operation with Section D when she is tasked with protecting an influential oil baron whose life is under threat. However, Harry and Lucas are suspicious and, after launching a secret surveillance operation on the magnates mansion, they discover he is planning an attack using a deadly nerve agent, with potentially disastrous consequences. Starring Sophia Myles and Peter Firth

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Madly in love with one of Lady Janes old school friends, Lovejoy finds it hard to keep his mind on work and mistakes a set of fake watercolours for the real thing. While hes off trying to put matters right, Eric takes charge of furnishing Dalrymples stately home - with disastrous results. Joanna Lumley guest stars

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del is invited to a school reunion at the Nags Head organised by old adversary Roy Slater (Jim Broadbent), who has recently been released from prison and claims to have turned over a new leaf. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: He Aint Heavy, Hes My Uncle
programme.desc: Uncle Albert falls victim to muggers, so Del-Boy resolves to take the law into his own hands, while Rodney becomes a director in Trotters Independent Traders - and his first job is to give the car a good clean. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Three Men, a Woman and a Baby
programme.desc: Rodney and Albert begin to worry the flat will get overcrowded as the birth of Del-Boy Jr approaches, while Del feels well prepared for fatherhood thanks to a stint at antenatal classes with Raquel. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The first episode of John Sullivans classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1981, which introduced the viewing public to the Trotter family. Rodney grows tired of being dogsbody to wheeler-dealing older brother Del-Boy and decides to set out on his own. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Lennard Pearce

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney make a bit of cash on a used-car deal and decide to celebrate in style with a night out in the West End. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del gets his hands on a statue of a Hindu god - which plunges him into the middle of an age-old feud between rival families. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: One of Dels old flames turns up out of the blue, so Rodney and Grandad resolve to extinguish any passion that might still be smouldering in the Peckham wide boys heart. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del spots another sure-fire winner and decides to enter the highly profitable tourist trade - and with Rodney and Grandad backing him 100 per cent, he is sure his open-top bus tour initiative will be a massive success. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del-Boy acquires three tons of lead sheeting, which turns out to be a DIY nuclear fallout shelter, so he, Rodney and Grandad collect their sleeping bags and food and have a practice run to make sure they will know what to do if the Russians attack

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: Gang member Tevin grows suspicious of Dom and Kay after following them to Hackney police station. Dom makes an unlikely elderly ally and Kays commitment to community service finally pays dividends. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun, with Zoe Wanamaker

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: In a bid to acquire help Dom and Kay meet up with Kirsty, who divulges some classified information - if only to stop Dom shouting at her running club - but crucially tells them she cannot help. Back on the estate, the pair are forced to deal with the consequences of their drug-dealing activities - at which point Dom receives a call from Celia Herrington, offering them freedom from the gang in return for the dossier. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun, with Zoe Wanamaker

programme.desc: Over a gourmet meal of pork chop, chips, beans and tea, the subject under discussion yet again is Denises impending wedding. programme.desc: With his daughter Denises wedding to Dave fast approaching, the arrival of a huge phone bill is the last thing Jim needs. First episode of the comedy, starring Ricky Tomlinson, Sue Johnston, Caroline Aherne, Craig Cash and Ralf Little. First broadcast in 1998

The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A 22-year-old woman goes into labour with her first child, and complications arise for a 37-year-old expectant mother. Fly-on-the-wall documentary observing the lives of staff at Princess Anne maternity hospital in Southampton, who - led by co-ordinator midwife Kay Duggan - help patients through the joys and sorrows of becoming parents

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The pressure becomes too much for one prospective father when midwives decide his girlfriend needs a Caesarean. Meanwhile, a diabetic mother-to-be anxiously waits to go into labour after being induced, and her frustration is exacerbated when her hospital lunch fails to arrive on time

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A woman longs to hold her baby, who was born with his bowels outside his body and has been in a critical condition ever since. Meanwhile, an expectant mother who underwent a Caesarean during the birth of her first child hopes her second delivery will go according to plan

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A mother coping with the death of her brother goes into labour with her fifth child, and her sister discusses how the pregnancy has helped the family cope with the bereavement. Meanwhile, a woman who received IVF treatment anxiously prepares to give birth, but when her waters fail to break she is asked to consider undergoing a Caesarean

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A teenager prepares for the birth of her first child, and her paramedic mother struggles with the prospect of her daughter becoming a parent. Plus, a free-spirited woman who is eight days overdue arrives at the hospital, but doctors become concerned by the babys heartbeat

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A man struggles with the knowledge that his partner is pregnant with someone elses child, but thoughts of paternity are pushed to the back of his mind when complications arise during labour. Meanwhile, an anxious husband finds it difficult to see his wife in so much pain during the birth of their first baby

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Football pundit Lee Dixon brings his beloved rescue dog to see Professor Noel Fitzpatrick, looking for help treating a limp and getting his pet back to full fitness. Elsewhere, a Springer Spaniel all the way from Guernsey is brought in for spinal surgery, and a Caucasian Shepherd puppy called Bear requires two hip replacements

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: In the first of a new series, Professor Noel Fitzpatrick and his team treat a giant Newfoundland puppy with a painful knee and shoulder. What appears straightforward quickly turns into a much bigger concern, and Noel and his team are challenged to invent not one but two new implants for her. Meanwhile, a rescue black Labrador called Moogi is in need of treatment for severe elbow arthritis, and a golden Labrador born with a deformed front paw is offered a bionic solution in the form of a unique, custom-made prosthesis

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Jamie and Stuart race to a supermarket where a man has collapsed doing his Christmas food shopping, while Dan and Holly visit the home of a familiar patient with chronic emphysema

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Its Christmas Day and Richard and Adam help a family who tragically face the loss of a loved one, while Dan and Becky are called out to a baby with a worryingly high temperature

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: A girl has an operation to have squints in both eyes realigned, a man has his infected gall bladder removed and an ex-police officer is having a grommet inserted in her ear

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: A woman has an operation to repair the hernia she suffered while giving birth and a four-year-olds ear blockage is so bad he needs a general anaesthetic to it sucked out

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: The teams deal with the range of emergencies that occur in the Val Thorens snowpark, including a teenager who has concussion and a man who breaks his spine

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Patients include Terri from Crewe, who ends up with more than 20 stitches in her shoulder, and Igor the Russian businessman, who refuses all medical assistance

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The three semi-finalists upgrade lakeside holiday lodges in the heart of the Cotswolds, each of which includes an open-plan kitchen, living and dining space and an outside terrace. The buildings are decidedly beige, giving the designers a blank canvas to work on - and knowing they are only one week away from the final they really go to town, with schemes ranging from bold primary colours inspired by a classic 1980s movie to a sophisticated monochrome look. Michelle Ogundehin judges their efforts with help from designer Abigail Ahern

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Chris and Tom go to the home of a young woman who is having suicidal thoughts. Ash becomes a passenger in his own ambulance when his grandad is taken ill

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Christian couple Judith and Mike put their faith in both God and the medical staff when things dont go to plan in the delivery room, and as 17-year-old Beths labour develops, her partner Dominic becomes more and more anxious. However, the expectant father risks missing out on the birth of his child by going for a smoke in the hospital car park

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: A musical family loves the LA home they purchased 11 years ago, but the choppy layout keeps them from inviting guests over. Jonathan and Drew open the floor plan

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: When they found a house on a hill with stunning views and a short commute to work, Brian and Lily knew it was their forever home - but the main floor layout needed work

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Derby to meet Rachel and Andy Smith, whose middle child Isaac has a severe form of cerebral palsy. The couple must be available at all times because Isaac sleeps in a hospital bed in the living room, but this is making life difficult for his siblings as their home design is in conflict with what the family really need. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team arrives to help, backed up by an army of local tradespeople - with designer Julia Kendall making sure they do not stray too far from her vision

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: Three contestants face a pressure test set by Michelin-starred chef Michael Wilson and must recreate his incredible Marguerite Opera dessert, nicknamed The Tower of Terror

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: The medical documentary concludes as paramedics help a woman who has had a violent seizure, and an elderly lady who had an unfortunate encounter with some bees

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick treats a Persian cat that has been hit by a car, requiring treatments involving a skin graft and putting its crushed bones back together. Meanwhile, a rescue dog has a cancerous tumour in his jaw removed, and a young staffie-cross needs treatment for a developmental elbow disease

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A 10-month-old puppy called Albie is knocked over by a car on a family camping holiday is rushed in as an emergency admission, and Noel Fitzpatrick fears this may be a life or death situation. Elsewhere, a Scottish terrier has a mysterious ailment, and a 16-month-old spaniel, is suffering from severe arthritis affecting both hips

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Its Changeover Day in Val Thorens, which means legions of first-time and out-of-practice skiers hitting the slopes with sometimes disastrous consequences

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Theres a rare crisis in Val Thorens when one of the highest cable cars in the world breaks down, leaving up to 100 people stuck 50 metres above the mountainside

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The two finalists go head to head, each taking on the redesign of a trendy bar in Londons vibrant Soho district. They have three days to make over the ground-floor bar and an intimate basement cocktail lounge - and to help, both contestants have a fellow team-mate, plus a team of trades. One designer goes all-out, relocating the bar to the other side of the room - but the more they rip out, the more it becomes a demolition zone. Down the road, there is indecision and angst as the other finalist realises just how much is at stake. Who will win the career-defining contract to design an upmarket apartment on the Cornish coast?

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: In Dudley, Ash and Jamie blue light to a frightened young woman with severe chest pains. Rachel and Mick are called to assist the police with a prisoner in Stoke

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On a railway journey from the capital Palermo, through the ancient town of Agrigento and the port of Siracusa, to Europes largest volcano, Mount Etna, Michael Portillo explores Sicilian life under the dictatorship. He also finds out how the dictator took on the Mafia and asks whether it is true that under Mussolini, the trains ran on time

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels by train through Austria and the Czech Republic, beginning in the northern Austrian city of Linz, where Adolf Hitler lived as a young boy. From here, Michael travels onto Prague Central Station, where he meets 87-year-old Zuzana Maresova, who, as a seven-year-old girl climbed aboard a train to travel to safety in London with hundreds of other Jewish children. Eventually crossing the Czech border into Slovakia, Michael reaches his final destination, one of Europes youngest capital cities, Bratislava

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Guided by his Bradshaws 1913 Handbook of Indian, Foreign and Colonial Travel, Michael Portillo embarks on a rail journey from Amritsar to Shimla. Along the way he helps to feed people at the worlds largest free kitchen, and travels the railway routes used by millions of migrants during Partition. Beginning in the Sikh holy city, Michael is dazzled by the beauty of the Golden Temple and awed by the scale of its langar - the worlds largest free kitchen. His route then takes him through the Punjab, and at Kalka, Michael glimpses the Himalayas for the first time

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Prawn trawlers Amity and Fruitful Bough head for Devils Hole, where they face a winter storm

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Jimmy considers whether his prawn trawler Amity should ride out a storm or head for port, and the pressure builds on the Ocean Venture skipper as the boat struggles to find haddock. The crew members depend on their catch making a profit, and a haul of cut-price coley will only cover the trips costs

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Skipper of the Ocean Venture John Buchan takes a huge risk in the deep and treacherous waters of the North Atlantic to find the perfect catch. Following the previous nights storm, the Amity crew faces a further setback, while Fruitful Bough fills its hold and heads for home

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.sub-title: Red E Type and Fast Fords
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome with the money. Two Ford Escorts get Daves pulse racing

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A widow reluctantly parts with her husbands treasured collection of Rolls-Royces and Bentleys, and an impulse buyer finds one of the cars a new home

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Jacks off to East Yorkshire for an iconic 1980s motor, where a Ford enthusiast is thinning out his herd of nine Escorts

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will are after an Italian car. However, they cannot the true classics so they let the budget dictate the vehicle and settle on an Alfa Romeo 155 from the 1990s. However, its hiding in a barn and making space for an inspection proves a challenge

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.sub-title: To the Ends of the Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the Arctic and Antarctic to explore the wildernesses at Earths poles, investigating the wildlife and geographical features found there. He begins by travelling to the North Pole, where two polar bears reveal a surprisingly tender side to their characters, before heading to the South Pole - 100 years after Roald Amundsen and Robert Falcon Scott first reached it

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: A polar bear hunts with her cubs, while the warmer weather of spring accelerates a process that will eventually see an area of ice the size of Australia disappear into the Arctic Ocean. A woolly bear caterpillar emerges from the snow after spending the winter frozen, and in Antarctica male Adelie penguins arrive to begin constructing nests in fierce storms as they try to attract mates

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: How animals in the polar regions adapt to the summer weather. In a colony of 400,000 king penguins the adults go surfing and the chicks take mud-baths to cool off, while polar bear cubs take their first swimming lessons as the ice they inhabit melts away. A minke whale is hunted by a family of killer whales, succumbing to their battering after two hours, and Adelie penguins try to prevent their chicks being snatched by skuas

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: With the arrival of autumn the Arctic Ocean begins freezing over, and polar bears gather in large numbers on the coast as they await the return of the ice. Two thousand beluga whales head for a particular estuary to thrash against the gravel and exfoliate, while in Antarctica, Adelie penguins take to the sea for the first time and face the danger of leopard seal attacks

programme.title: Ireland with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Part one of two. Simon explores the history of both the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland and examines the rich culture and troubled past of the island. Simon arrives by ferry in Co Wexford and travels along the coast, joining the thousands who try to climb the sacred mountain of Croagh Patrick. He crosses the border to visit Crom Castle and Londonderry, before journeying to the northernmost point at Malin Head

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will are after an Italian car. However, they cannot the true classics so they let the budget dictate the vehicle and settle on an Alfa Romeo 155 from the 1990s. However, its hiding in a barn and making space for an inspection proves a challenge

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Jacks off to East Yorkshire for an iconic 1980s motor, where a Ford enthusiast is thinning out his herd of nine Escorts

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Anglophile Derek struggles to get his message across on a rare trip abroad to pick up a Bentley, while a well-restored Ford XR2 sets the auction alight

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds a very rare 70s Sunbeam Lotus that has been rotting away in a farmyard for 29 years, while a Morris Minor convertible goes under the hammer

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three MGs from the 70s turn up at the garage, still covered in original factory wax. Nobody can believe it, or value them. A Morris 1000 turns up at the auction along with a TR7 V8

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team buy one of Dereks favourite Austin commercials and convert it to electric, and also snap up a super-rare 50s American beach bike

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a thousand-mile journey from the Swedish capital of Stockholm to Abisko in the northern reaches of the Arctic Circle. In Stockholm, Michael braves a precarious tour of the city from its rooftops before boarding a heritage tram to get the lowdown on 1930s Sweden from an expert. Moving on, he finishes his journey deep in the Arctic Circle at a remote climate research station. He also has lunch with traditional Sami people in Vilhelmina and checks into an ice hotel

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo examines the history of the American rail network, using Appletons General Guide to the United States and Canada of 1879 to plot his course. He begins on Manhattan Island and travels from Grand Central Terminal to the site of Ground Zero

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A beautiful looking sports car has been fooling the punters and intriguing Derek. Its a Challenger E-Type - a fibreglass replica created from an E-Type mould

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul and Jack head to Staffordshire to pick up five vehicles from collector Robs colossal barn, including a Mini and a Morris Minor

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Albert Speer, the apolitical architect whose desire to build grand buildings led him to sell his soul

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of the Allied forces hunt for Joachim Peiper, the man responsible for the massacre of American PoWs in Malmedy, Belgium

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second of two programmes from the Royal Hall, Harrogate, where Phillip Mould examines an ink drawing that he believes may have been made by Picasso. John Axford challenges Fiona to guess the odd one out from four tea bowls, and Jon Baddeley values a model ship that took more than 30 years to build

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum. Finds brought in to be valued include some jewellery from the art deco era, a painting by artistic group the Glasgow Girls, and an ugly family heirloom that turns out to have been made by a very important historical figure - and is worth far more than its owners suspected

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drags a mini pickup out of the barn where its been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Four VW camper vans pitch up at the auction house looking for a new home and Derek picks up an Austin 16 that goes like stink and has some unusual modern modifications

programme.desc: Albert Speer, the apolitical architect whose desire to build grand buildings led him to sell his soul

programme.title: Nazi Hunters

programme.title: Cornwall with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which the explorer travels through Cornwall as its emerges from the first lockdown, discovering the impact of Covid-19 on a part of the country highly reliant on tourism. Simon discovers the ongoing impact of the collapse of the tin-mining industry in the 1980s when he visits one of Britains poorest estates, and meets the entrepreneurs who sell homemade food on the beach who are struggling to make enough money to last the winter

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The fourth leg of the adventurers journey takes him from Oman to the Maldives. He starts in the Strait of Hormuz, where oil from the Gulf is shipped through the narrow channel, then moves on to Mumbai, the oceans biggest port. In the Maldives, Simon finds arguably the most beautiful collection of tropical coral islands in the world - but the fragile underwater environment is a barometer for the changing nature of the sea, as he witnesses how bleaching has damaged the coral and an entire island has been manufactured as a landfill dump to deal with the problem of rubbish

programme.title: The Lakes with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer explores the beautiful and unique landscapes of the Lake District, beginning by meeting Cumbrians with different visions for the future of Englands biggest national park. He talks to members of a campaign group trying to protect the remaining red squirrels, a traditional farmer who feels that his ancient way of life is on the point of extinction, and an 18-year-old student who runs a 1,500-acre farm

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drags a mini pickup out of the barn where its been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A beautiful looking sports car has been fooling the punters and intriguing Derek. Its a Challenger E-Type - a fibreglass replica created from an E-Type mould

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon and Henry head to an old Second World War airfield in Wiltshire. Simon decides to restore a 1970s caravan while Henry opts for a boat

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring Oradour-sur-Glane, a French town drenched in infamy. Also, Alcatraz, a facility famed for breakouts but also subjected to a daring break-in

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo takes in Georgia and Azerbaijan as he journeys through the former Russian empire. He begins in the port of Batumi, discovers a surprise 19th-century tea plantation in the West Georgian countryside, visits a private museum dedicated to Joseph Stalin - the most infamous Georgian of all - and discovers that a Briton was the first to conquer the highest mountain in the Caucasus range. Arriving in Azerbaijan, he learns about its role in the 19th-century oil industry

programme.title: Raymond Blancs Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: The chef goes behind the scenes of Dumfries House in Ayrshire, where he finds out about the structure and scale of the Queen Elizabeth walled garden. He also hears how King Charless passion for sustainability is being passed on to a new generation

programme.title: MandS: Dress the Nation
programme.desc: AJ Odudu and Vernon Kay host as the amateur designers face the challenges of menswear week, with Mark Wright the guest judge joining MandS lead designers and customers to decide who will have the chance of winning the life-changing prize

programme.title: James Martins Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by singer James Morrison, while there are recipes from chefs Aktar Islam, Shivi Ramoutar and Daniel Clifford

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan are comedian and actor Les Dennis and actress Samantha Womack, who talks about her return to the stage in the critically acclaimed Dear England. Plus, Camilla Bassett-Smith harvests apples and there is the first instalment of a new series celebrating young farmers

programme.title: EFL Live
programme.desc: Ipswich Town v Norwich City (Kick-off 12.00pm). Hugh Woozencroft presents coverage of the East Anglia derby in the Championship, held at Portman Road. The teams last met in the 2023/24 season when they shared the spoils in a 2-2 draw here, before Norwich claimed a 1-0 win at Carrow Road. With commentary from Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward, analysis by Matt Holland and Dean Ashton, and reports from Aaron Paul

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani, Ed Chamberlin and Oli Bell present coverage of the prestigious middle-distance race from Paris-Longchamp, plus the support races. Rossa Ryan rode Bluestocking to victory in last years renewal. With commentary by Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.sub-title: AJ Pritchard, Hollie Arnold, Giovanna Fletcher and Russell Watson
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts an Im a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here special as former participants AJ Pritchard, Hollie Arnold, Giovanna Fletcher and Russell Watson pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: MandS: Dress the Nation
programme.desc: AJ Odudu and Vernon Kay host the semi-final as the amateur designers try to impress guest judge Lily Cole, with the model joining MandS lead designers and customers to decide who goes through to the final for the chance of winning the life-changing prize

programme.title: Mahons Way
programme.desc: Joe Mahon visits the historic village of Derrygonnelly, set in the pristine landscape of Co Fermanagh, and explores castles, craftwork and converted churches

programme.title: Rare Breed - A Farming Year
programme.desc: It is September and Tim is anxious to find out how many of his cows at Steamvale Farm are expecting calves in 2023

programme.title: Frauds
programme.desc: When Bert is released from prison after 10 years, there is only one person she can turn to, her former partner-in-crime Sam. Bert rekindles their friendship and tries to convince Sam to help with her dying wish of one last job. Crime thriller, starring Suranne Jones and Jodie Whittaker

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Batman Begins
programme.desc: Billionaire Bruce Wayne travels the world seeking the means to fight injustice, consumed with rage over his parents murder. Trained by a secret society, he hones his fighting skills and returns to his home city of Gotham on a mission to rid it of crime and corruption in the guise of a masked vigilante. Comic-book adventure, exploring the origins of the Dark Knight, with Christian Bale, Michael Caine, Liam Neeson, Cillian Murphy, Gary Oldman and Katie Holmes

programme.title: The Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Brian Dowling and his fashion-forward design team continue their mission to prove to the nation that it is possible achieve a dream home renovation at little cost. Changing Rooms meets the Repair Shop with a new sustainable twist, the challenge here is to transform our bland old rooms, furniture and fittings into unique and stunning show stoppers, using only upcycling and sustainable methods. This is the home makeover format for the world we live in today, as two households per week, each with a team consisting of an interior designer and an up-cycling wiz, have just four days and 1,000 euro to renovate and rejuvenate a tired spaces in their home, filling them with home-made, re-used and revamped furnishings. Two families are selected from the same region each week and each has a tired room in need of renovation and re-imagining containing a potential treasure trove of up-cycling gems

programme.title: Hospital
programme.desc: The documentary charting the day-to-day realities faced by workers in the NHS returns, picking up with staff at St Marys Hospital in London on March 22nd 2017, the day of the Westminster terror attack. St Marys is one of the capitals four Major Trauma Centres, and staff are well-versed in Major Incident Protocols that come into effect in the wake of events such as terrorist activity. Arrangements are made to transfer some of the hospitals critically ill patients to a sister site at Charring Cross, giving the AandE team more scope to help the victims, including teenagers Yann and Victor; French students in London on a school trip. Also admitted is Stephen, who needs immediate surgery to save his leg, and his wife Cara shares her thoughts on the helplessness felt by the families of those most gravely injured as a result of these incidents

programme.title: Ana Kriegel: A Young Life Lost
programme.desc: In May 2018, Russian-Irish teenager Ana Kriegel was lured from her home and brutally killed in a derelict house in Lucan. The awful crime was all the more disturbing when her killers were revealed to be two 13-year-old boys - now the youngest convicted murderers in the history of the state. Here, senior journalists, barristers and family friends tell Anas story, looking at the circumstances around her murder, the extensive Garda investigation and the trial that followed. Featuring a series of new photographs released by Anas family, the documentary also examines the sentencing in this unprecedented case and explores the lasting impact of Anas death

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: Drama following people from all walks of life during the first year of the Second World War, beginning in the run-up to its outbreak. American journalist and broadcaster Nancy Campbell makes a grisly discovery at the Polish-German border, while in Manchester, Lois waits for news of her translator boyfriend Harry. However, Lois is unaware that Harry has a secret Polish lover, Kasia, and he has vowed to help her flee from Warsaw. Starring Sean Bean, Helen Hunt, Lesley Manville, Julia Brown and Jonah Hauer-King

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick, Jo and Katie prepare to leave Aidensfield, while mysterious bumps in the night make Greengrass wonder if his house is haunted. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketon is abducted by an old Army friend and former Japanese PoW camp inmate, whose wifes death has left him mentally unbalanced, while Greengrass is well and truly fleeced by father-and-son conmen. Bill Maynard, Derek Fowlds and John Alderton star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A girl takes an overdose and Blaketons mysterious private life comes to light when his car goes missing and is involved in an accident. Rural police drama, starring Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Debbie investigates Abis secret visits to her hotel, Theo begrudges Billy some of Todds time, Glenda offers to help Jenny to bag a date with George, and Nina worries when Asha turns to alcohol to blot out her troubles

programme.desc: Jenny has some apologising to do when Rita catches her in a lie, Debbie instructs Abi to pack her bags, Dev discovers that Asha is still avoiding work, and Theo bumps into a blast from his past in the gay village

programme.title: Live Racing
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani, Ed Chamberlin and Oli Bell present coverage of the prestigious Prix de lArc de Triomphe from Paris-Longchamp, plus the support races. Rossa Ryan rode Bluestocking to victory in last years renewal. With commentary by Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Ainsleys National Trust Cook Off
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is joined by chefs Tristan Welch and Philli Armitage-Mattin at the Wimpole Estate in Cambridgeshire to see who can create and cook the Dish of the Day. Ainsley makes beetroot and carrot patties with a vegan horseradish yoghurt, Tristan brings his passion for zero-waste cooking to the kitchen with his honey and lemon roasted carrots with spiced-up beans, and Philli uses her knowledge of Japanese cuisine to make a summer vegetable pancake with garlic aioli

programme.title: Judi Loves Culinary Cruise
programme.desc: The comedians adventures take her to the Greek island of Corfu, where she buys a huge block of butter, gets nostalgic over nutmeg, visits a restaurant thats been run by the same family for 100 years and learns how to make pastitsada, a beef-based pasta dish. Then its back to the yacht to make spicy lamb chops with saffron rice and a yoghurt and cucumber salad

programme.title: Inside Dubai: Playground of the Rich
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on some of the aspirational Brits who are choosing to live and work in Dubai and see how the people attracted there have changed over the course of its brief 50-year history. Mark is fresh off the plane having quit his job stacking shelves in a supermarket back home in Newcastle, but an unexpected offer of work presents him with a difficult decision

programme.title: Finders Keepers
programme.desc: When Martin and Ashley embark on a metal detecting trip in the fields of a farm they find a hoard of buried Saxon treasure worth millions. They must deal with the dilemma of declaring it or selling it privately with the help of Ashleys ex-con friend. Drama, starring Neil Morrissey, James Buckley and Fay Ripley

programme.title: Mum
programme.desc: Cathy and her family arrive in the countryside to celebrate Dereks birthday. Michael is there too, which Jason finds troubling. Family comedy, starring Lesley Manville, Peter Mullan, Sam Swainsbury and Ross Boatman

programme.title: Mum
programme.desc: In the finale series, Cathy and her family decamp to the English countryside to celebrate Dereks birthday. This time, the family are recovering from a party the night before, and as Cathy nurses a hangover, she learns that she and Michael were less than discreet in front of the others. Subtle comedy, starring Lesley Manville and Peter Mullan

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: When the banks start issuing paper notes instead of gold, Demelza finds herself thrown into uncharted waters with her workers and the locals, a situation taken advantage of by Tess and Jacka. Morwenna tackles the grief of being parted from her son, while Geoffrey Charles makes plain his intent to marry Cecily, landing both of them in trouble. George conspires once more against Ned and the Poldarks as he and his allies enact a plan to destroy their opposition for good. Drama, starring Aidan Turner

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: The medic investigates when a businessman is found drowned in the swimming baths after the grand unveiling of his plans for a local theme park about the Ballarat gold rush

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A father is aghast to read tales of wild romance in his teenage daughters diary, failing to realise they are all fictitious. David inherits a ventriloquists dummy complete with a schedule of bookings, and decides the show must go on. Meanwhile, Gina finds herself attracted to a charismatic guest. Nostalgic drama, starring David Lonsdale and Tricia Penrose

programme.title: My Unique BandB
programme.desc: Simon Parfett and his team create an unusual BandB in Devon for Michele and Tobin, who want to turn their tired summerhouse into a property that could accommodate four-legged guests

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A dark family secret comes to light when a female hit-and-run suspect claims the woman she deliberately ran over on a pedestrian crossing was a ghost. However, the facts of the case tell a different story. Gwen Taylor guest stars, with Jack Shepherd

programme.title: Storage Hoarders
programme.desc: Aggie MacKenzie and the team revisit Adie and Tone in Yeovil, Somerset, to help clear the remainder of their clutter. Plus, antiques restorer and dealer Peter is ready to start a new chapter in his life but needs to get rid of his hoard first

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A single mother from Sunderland asks Kavanagh to prosecute the neighbourhood vigilante she suspects of attempting to murder her teenage tearaway son in a hit-and-run incident. At first he has misgivings about accepting a case so far from home, but finally agrees _ only to find his already strained family life suffering as a result. Tense legal drama, starring John Thaw and Lisa Harrow, with a guest appearance by Robert Glenister

programme.title: Judge Rinders Crime Stories
programme.desc: The barrister examines two more real-life cases, including that of Darrell Simester, who was held against his will for 13 years on a farm in Newport, Wales. Plus, the case of Paul Roylance, who stole the money left to his mother Shelley when his father lost his life to cancer

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An accidental shooting at Ashfordly Hall prompts Bellamy to investigate reports accusing acting estate manager Richard Bentham of exploiting youngsters for child labour, but his enquiries reveal a far more complicated situation. Peggy discovers a promising new source of revenue when she realises there is a market for guided tours of the area, but her excitement is cut short by a terrifying encounter. Rural drama, guest starring former Emmerdale actor Peter Amory, with Mark Jordon, Rupert Vansittart and Gwen Taylor

programme.title: The Deal Makers
programme.desc: Following the biggest characters from the world of pawn broking as they uncover the stories behind the most amazing objects being bought, sold and loaned against
